div.l: And schortely for to seyn̄ they wer͗e at one
Now pley Aleyn̄ for y woll of Iohn
This Iohn lyeth stylle a furlong wey or two
And to hym self maketh routh and wo
Allas quoth he this ys a wyked Iape
Now may y seyn̄ y am but an ape
Yette hath my felow somwhat for his harm
He hath þe myllers doughter in his arme
He auntred hym and hath his nedes spedde
And y lye as a draffe sak in my bedde
And when̄ this Iape ys told a noth̉er day
I schall be holde a daffe a Cokenay
I woll aryse and aunter hit by my faith
Vnhardy ys vnsely þus men̄ seith
And up he rose and softely he wente
Vn to þe cradel and in his hond hit hente
And bare hit softe vn to the beddꝰes Fete
Sone after the wyfe her rowtyng lete
And gan̄ to wake and wente hur oute to pysse
And com̄e agayn̄ and gan̄ her cradel mysse
And groped her͗e and ther͗e but sche fonde non̄e
Allas qduoth sche y had almost mysse gon̄
Y had almost gon̄ to the clerkꝭes bedde
Ey benedicite than̄ had y foule y spedde
And forth sche goth tyll sche þe cᵃradel fond
She gropeth alwey further with her hond
And fonde the bedde and thougte nought but gode
By cause that þe cradel by hit stode
And nyste wher͗e sche was for hit was derke
But fayre and well sche crepte in to the clerke
And lyeth full stylle and wold haue kaught a slepe
With in a while this Iohn up lepe
And on̄ this god wyf he leyeth on sor͗e
So mery a Fytte ne had sche not full yor͗e
